page.title: 04Cotswold Walls in Fairford
page.content: In the Cotswolds there are lots of Cotswold dry stone walls. The stone they use comes from{local quarries (Southrop or Eastleach). To build the stone walls you need to have the stones slanting, because when it rains the water will then run off the wall. The{tools}used to make the walls are called a stone hammer and a line. The line is used for making the wall straight and the stone hammer is used for making the stone the right shape to fit in the wall.{Today}there are not many people who can build the walls. The most you can build in one day is about four metres of wall. The usual height of the walls is one metre.
